children.text: Basic Probability: For event A, \(P(A) = \frac{\text{Number of favorable outcomes}}{\text{Total number of outcomes}}\). \(0 \leq P(A) \leq 1\). \(P(\text{certain event}) = 1\), \(P(\text{impossible event}) = 0\).
Complement Rule: \(P(A') = 1 - P(A)\) where \(A'\) is complement of A. \(P(A) + P(A') = 1\).
Addition Rule: \(P(A \cup B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A \cap B)\). For mutually exclusive events: \(P(A \cup B) = P(A) + P(B)\) since \(P(A \cap B) = 0\).
Conditional Probability: \(P(A|B) = \frac{P(A \cap B)}{P(B)}\) where \(P(B) \neq 0\). This gives probability of A given that B has occurred.
Multiplication Rule: \(P(A \cap B) = P(A) \cdot P(B|A) = P(B) \cdot P(A|B)\). For independent events: \(P(A \cap B) = P(A) \cdot P(B)\).
Bayes' Theorem: \(P(A_i|B) = \frac{P(B|A_i) \cdot P(A_i)}{\sum_{j=1}^{n} P(B|A_j) \cdot P(A_j)}\) where \(A_1, A_2, ..., A_n\) form a partition of sample space.
Random Variable Expectation: For discrete random variable X, \(E(X) = \sum_{i} x_i P(X = x_i)\). Properties: \(E(aX + b) = aE(X) + b\), \(E(X + Y) = E(X) + E(Y)\).
Variance: \(\text{Var}(X) = E(X^2) - [E(X)]^2 = E[(X - \mu)^2]\) where \(\mu = E(X)\). \(\text{Var}(aX + b) = a^2\text{Var}(X)\). Standard deviation \(\sigma = \sqrt{\text{Var}(X)}\).
Binomial Distribution: \(P(X = r) = \binom{n}{r} p^r q^{n-r}\) where \(q = 1-p\). Mean \(= np\), Variance \(= npq\). Used for n independent trials with constant probability p.
Normal Distribution: \(f(x) = \frac{1}{\sigma\sqrt{2\pi}} e^{-\frac{(x-\mu)^2}{2\sigma^2}}\). Standard normal: \(\mu = 0, \sigma = 1\). \(Z = \frac{X - \mu}{\sigma}\) converts to standard normal.
Linear Regression: Line of regression of Y on X: \(y - \bar{y} = r \frac{\sigma_y}{\sigma_x}(x - \bar{x})\). Line of regression of X on Y: \(x - \bar{x} = r \frac{\sigma_x}{\sigma_y}(y - \bar{y})\).
